meanings.definition: A wedge or block placed against a wheel or rounded object to prevent it from moving.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic placed chocks under the car's wheels to keep it from rolling.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to always use chocks when parking on a slope to avoid accidents.
meanings.sent3: The chocks decided to take a break and relax by the tire, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like sturdy chocks, keeping her from being swayed by doubts.
meanings.sent5: The chocks were like loyal guards, standing firm and protecting the wheel from any movement.

meanings.definition: To secure or support with chocks.
meanings.sent1: He chocks the airplane wheels before the passengers board.
meanings.sent2: Remember to always chocks the boat properly before leaving the dock.
meanings.sent3: The chef chocks the cutting board in place to prevent it from sliding around.
meanings.sent4: She chocks her emotions, not letting them overwhelm her during stressful times.
meanings.sent5: The mountain climber chocks the rope securely, ensuring a safe ascent.

meanings.definition: A pair of metal or wooden supports used to hold a boat or ship in place.
meanings.sent1: The sailor placed the chocks on the dock to secure the ship in position.
meanings.sent2: The chocks were essential for keeping the boat steady during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on one of the chocks, pretending to be a ship captain.
meanings.sent4: The chocks were like sturdy pillars, holding the boat firmly in place.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor always trusted his lucky chocks to keep his vessel safe at sea.
